snippet: A government survey of prison and jail inmates challenged the notion that minors in adult facilities face a higher risk of sexual abuse than other prisoners.
abstract: Bureau of Justice Statistics survey of prison and jail inmates finds that juveniles did not report significantly more sexual victimization than adult inmates; advocacy groups contest numbers in survey, arguing that many juveniles housed with adults are afraid to report sexual abuse and that true figures are likely to be far higher.
lead_paragraph: A government survey of prison and jail inmates challenged the notion that minors in adult facilities face a higher risk of sexual abuse than other prisoners.

headline.main: Juvenile Inmates Found to Be at No Greater Risk for Prison Rape
headline.print_headline: Juvenile Inmates Found to Be at No Greater Risk for Prison Rape
